parts.text: {"word":"acomodarse","priority":"N/A","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"pronominal (reflexive)","definition":"順応する、適応する、慣れる","english_definition":"to adapt, adjust, or accommodate oneself to something; to get used to something.","examples":[{"sentence":"Debes acomodarte a las nuevas reglas.","translation":"新しい規則に順応しなければならない。","sentence":"Me estoy acomodando a mi nuevo trabajo.","translation":"新しい仕事に慣れてきている。","sentence":"Es difícil acomodarse a vivir en una ciudad tan grande.","translation":"こんなに大きな都市での生活に慣れるのは難しい。"}],"collocations":["acomodarse a la situación (状況に適応する)","acomodarse al clima (気候に慣れる)","acomodarse a las costumbres (習慣に慣れる)","acomodarse a las normas (規則に適応する)"],"synonyms":["adaptarse","ajustarse","habituarse","familiarizarse","aclimatarse"],"antonyms":["desacostumbrarse","desadaptarse"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"pronominal (reflexive)","definition":"（場所に）落ち着く、身を置く、座る、居心地よくする","english_definition":"to settle down, make oneself comfortable (in a place); to sit down.","examples":[{"sentence":"Acomódate en el sofá, por favor.","translation":"ソファに座って楽にしてください。"},{"sentence":"Nos acomodamos en nuestros asientos para ver la película.","translation":"映画を見るために席に着いた。"},{"sentence":"Acomódate como si estuvieras en tu casa.","translation":"自分の家にいるようにくつろいでください。"}],"collocations":["acomodarse en un asiento (席に座る)","acomodarse en el sofá (ソファに座る)","acomodarse en la cama (ベッドに横になる)","acomodarse en un lugar (場所に落ち着く)"],"synonyms":["instalarse","ubicarse","sentarse","colocarse","establecerse"],"antonyms":["levantarse","moverse","desplazarse"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"pronominal (reflexive)","definition":"（要求、必要などに）応じる、合わせる、譲歩する","english_definition":"to accommodate, comply with, or yield to a request or need; to compromise.","examples":[{"sentence":"El gobierno se acomodó a las demandas de los manifestantes.","translation":"政府はデモ参加者の要求に応じた。"},{"sentence":"Tenemos que acomodarnos a las circunstancias.","translation":"状況に合わせる必要がある。"},{"sentence":"Ella siempre se acomoda a los deseos de los demás.","translation":"彼女はいつも他人の希望に合わせる。"}],"collocations":["acomodarse a las necesidades (必要に応じる)","acomodarse a las exigencias (要求に応じる)","acomodarse a los deseos (希望に応じる)","acomodarse a las circunstancias (状況に合わせる)"],"synonyms":["complacer","ceder","transigir","adaptarse","ajustarse"],"antonyms":["resistirse","oponerse","negarse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Derived from the verb 'acomodar' (to accommodate, to fit), which comes from Latin 'accommodare' (to adjust, to adapt). The reflexive form 'acomodarse' indicates that the action is performed on oneself.","priority":"N/A"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/a.ko.moˈðaɾ.se/","syllables":"a-co-mo-dar-se"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["me acomodo","te acomodas","se acomoda","nos acomodamos","os acomodáis","se acomodan"],"past_simple":"me acomodé","te acomodaste","se acomodó","nos acomodamos","os acomodasteis","se acomodaron"],"imperative":{"formal_singular":"acomódese","formal_plural":"acomódense"}}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Acomodarse' is a reflexive verb, meaning the action is performed by the subject on themselves. It has several related meanings, including adapting to a situation, making oneself comfortable, and complying with requests. The specific meaning depends on the context.","priority":"N/A"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo acomodo a la situación.","correct":"Yo me acomodo a la situación.","note":"Remember that 'acomodarse' is a reflexive verb, so you need to use the reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se)."},{"incorrect":"Acomodar a la silla.","correct":"Acomodarse en la silla.","note":"When referring to sitting down or getting comfortable in a place, use the preposition 'en' (in)."}],"priority":"N/A"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["acomodar (to accommodate, to fit)","acomodación (accommodation)","acomodado (comfortable, well-off)"],"phrases":["acomodarse las gafas (to adjust one's glasses)","acomodarse el cinturón (to fasten one's seatbelt)"],"priority":"N/A"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B1","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively common in Spanish.","priority":"N/A"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"'Acomodarse' is a reflexive verb with multiple meanings related to adapting, settling, and complying. It's important to use the reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se) and to pay attention to the context to understand the specific meaning. Common uses include adapting to a new situation, making oneself comfortable in a place, and complying with requests or demands."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Es importante acomodarse a los cambios en el trabajo.","translation":"It's important to adapt to changes at work.","type":"meaning: adapt","meaning_category":"adapt"},{"sentence":"Por favor, acomódate en el sillón.","translation":"Please, make yourself comfortable in the armchair.","type":"meaning: settle","meaning_category":"settle"},{"sentence":"El hotel se acomodó a nuestras necesidades.","translation":"The hotel accommodated our needs.","type":"meaning: comply","meaning_category":"comply"}]}
